data.title: Cats as Living Art: The Innovative Project Frame Your Feline
data.meta_description: Pet Parents Create Feline Friendly Wall Shelves and Decoration, Turning Cats into Pieces of Living Art.  Importance of animal rescue and pet adoption is also discussed.
data.text:
Julie Marty-Pearson: 0:45

hello,my friends and fellow animal lovers.Welcome to another episode of the Story of My PET podcast.I am your host,Julie Marty Pearson,as always,and I'm excited to welcome a pair of guests today.Yay.I think this is actually my first duo.Wow.Ooh.And my first male guest on the podcast.Oh hello?Yes.Oh boy.Welcome.Brian Vermeer and Kristina Hughes.Thank you both so much.Hi.Hi Julie.Hi Julie.Hi.Thank you so much for being here.It's so funny,I just thought of all those things as I was getting ready to introduce you so you can feel very special,Brian,as first.I,I'm expecting a plaque.You're gonna,you're gonna send a plaque to me,right?Yeah.And you'll hang it right there between the two feline frames.Oh my gosh,yes.You got it.It's going right there.Yeah.Okay.So I'm gonna tell my listeners a little more about you before we get into it.Christina and Brian are LA based entrepreneurs,standup comedians,and loving cat parents to seven rescues.I love this living on the edge of Los Angeles County.It makes it sound much more fancier than what it is.It's fancy out here.Come on.Oh.It's fancy.Just as fancy as me in Bakersfield,so it's okay.They.Believe that cat parents shouldn't have to suffer with the ugly aesthetic of cat trees and boring cat shelves in order to give their cats vertical space.So true.In an effort to showcase their cats and uplevel the decor their home,they created Frame Your Feline,which allows cat owners to enjoy seeing their.Pose within Works of Living Art.It's so great and you can see it in the video.I will definitely be posting and one of their cats is illustrating it for us right now.That's Winnie.That's amazing.So we're gonna talk about this amazing art.That you guys have created for people and just overall seven rescues.I can't wait to hear all about it.So thank you Brian and Kristina again for being here.And Winnie.And Winnie.Yes.I think I'm gonna have to grab my phone to take a picture of that because it is,I just love it when like the cats know.She's ready and she very ready.Our kittens,Holly and Jolly,are right underneath our feet playing with a spider a plastic one from our son's Halloween collection.And somebody's under a rug.Yeah,they're going.I'll see them.I'll get them eventually.Okay.So I think we have a lot to talk about I guess I'm gonna let you guys decide where you wanna start,but I would say let's start talking to about your love of pets.The fact that you have seven,show me that you guys are true cat parents and pet lovers.So let's talk about for each of you,or together as a couple where your love for animals started.Where did your love of animals start,Brian?When I was a tiny young lad I had a dog and it was a huge dog.It was an old English sheep dog named Maisie.Oh,wow.And this was the best dog ever.If sheep dogs,they've got that big fluff of hair and she would actually,she learned how to grab.Our legs and then tackle us onto the ground.So we would literally be playing football out on our side yard and all the neighbor kids and everything,and the dog would be there and tackling us.It was so much fun.So I loved my dog and I never had a cat,didn't understand what cats were,didn't think cats were worthy of any special attention.I didn't care.I just didn't care.And then you fast forward and I meet Kristina.Who had cats?And that's when it all went downhill for me.Just when I was born,my parents were in a little teeny tiny one bedroom apartment.They were in college and I guess they had eight cats,and then somebody's cat had a litter and they gave my mom cats and they just had tons of cats.So I've always had.Those cats were adopted out.I had Misty and Mr.Dylan when I was really little.We were in a fire on Christmas Eve.They escaped,but we never found them.And so then I had another cat named Misty.I'm often commenting on people's black cats on Instagram under our account going,my first cat,what's a black cat named Misty.And basically I moved to California,didn't have a cat,and Brian and I started cohabitating and the cat found.We'll just say on our street,she kept following us home and once you feed someone else's cat,they're gonna be yours.And we found out she was in a bad situation and we were able to adopt her.Julie,lemme ask you a question.Do you remember there's this there was this movie I believe it was Stephen Spielberg a famous director.Don't know if you know who that is.I think I've heard of him.Reem.You ever hear this movie Gremlins?Yes.So one of the rules of gremlins is don't get them wet because then they multiply.So yes,basically we had one cat and then we must have got it wet because now all of a sudden it's like cats coming out of the wazo.We love cats.I can't get enough of cats.Have you realized I'm a changed man?You are a changed man,but I totally get Your change because I too never had cats growing up.We had dogs.My mom was allergic.Turned out she was afraid of cats.Yes.No comment for the mother-in-law.Sorry.And then I got my first cat,which then it turned into four cats.So yes,I do understand.And they find you,it's like they know they have a homing beacon on us.Cat people go.Once the shell is pride open,it's open season and we have a very strict policy.When something sad happens,when a cat passes away,we have to get two kittens.Or a bonded pair of two or three year old cats.I'm not liking that math.No,I'm not liking that Math.We lost our frosty who's on our blog,who was the first cat to be in our product has a alpha tester.We lost him in January and so we adopted two kittens that are now one,and they still have kitten energy up the wazo.They are.I like that,math.Then I'm gonna tell my husband that is actually the way it's supposed to be.Cause I've never,the last two cats that we lost was,were never replaced.So he technically owes me four cats.Yes.No,but I also agree with you,adopting cats in pairs is really the way to go,whether you don't have any or you have one.Because a lot of times socially as kittens,they're so bonded and that kitten energy,they have someone to take it out on.And even if they're not technically actual siblings,right?Like we rescued Poppy and Mojave in2019from the Palmdale Animal Care Center,and they are not from the same litter.They're a month apart,but they still cuddle and groom each other.And especially when they were first here,Brian was like,oh my God,I've never been around kittens.And they're just,oh,yeah.So they do get their energy out on each other.Yeah.There's nothing like hidden energy.It goes like to100and then down to zero,just as fast.Like when they're out.Yeah.Yeah.Nothing beats the energy of a cat after having used the litter box and they get the zoomies,and spread the little bit of litter all over the house.Yes,it happens.Yes,I deal with it.He hates it.So you have,you currently have seven cats?And that is Winnie okay?Yes.She seem very cute.I'll try to find Ds of one eyed cat that we rescued from the streets of Los Angeles.Someone abused him and kicked them out of her apartment.So we have Tu.Winnie,poppy,Mojave,Holly,and Jolly.And then someone dumped a cat in our neighborhood last summer who we trapped,neutered,got all the shots with the intentions of keeping him inside.And this one was like,let's just let him out of the indoor patio now that he is talking to the other cats.And we woke up in the morning and he wasn't in our house.We were like that.It was really quiet.He.Outside at the front door waiting for breakfast.He escaped.He escaped through a screen and he was like knock.Where's my food?Yeah.Yeah.So he has now decided he wants to live in our backyard,which.We are thinking of trying to re trap him,but we've tried to re trap him and he really wants to just live in our backyard and we are in a very quiet area.Yeah.That's good.Yeah.Sometimes cats let us know what they want whether we like it or not.Yeah.Seven Cats.What inspired you guys to start your feline frames or frame your feline?Sorry.That's okay.Company.I think it,one,one of the first things was we had a cat tree.In our apartment in l in LA when we were first dating and first dating not prepared but it eventually happened,right?We ended up having cats,got rescue frost,frosty,and our hairdresser gave us this brand new cat tree.And we were like,Ugh.And it was ugly.The shag carpeting was getting everywhere.It just looked,started getting rat.Then in the smell started to happen and there's just all,there's dust mites in it.It's just it's nasty.Cat trees are gross,they're just gross.And frosty would hide in the bottom of it all the time.We're like,come on out.Live your life.But cats need vertical space.And when we bought our house and we were hanging up pictures and artwork and stuff,and then we were like,It'd be cool to see our cats in a frame,and then,Kind of things started going off in our heads and the other thing was we would always try to dress frosty and Maggie and costumes for Christmas and we'd have our friend come over from across the street and take pictures and we're like holding them.They're like,I hate this Snowman outfit.Yeah.And I hate this dress and we're trying to get a family photo,and it was just always impossible.And getting great pictures of your cat.Almost impossible,right?Yeah,cuz they do this thing where they don't post.So we came up with this concept of a frame connected with shelves that you install on your wall.And we,we initially had this first version we worked with my.Who's,he's an engineer.An engineer.Retired.Super brilliant.Genius man.I don't know what happened to me.So he's,so he,we started talking about the idea and.He's really good with his hands and woodworking and problem solving and everything.And so we started getting to designing it,see how would it look?And our first iteration.Was more of like a square.And it looked like you were looking through a window rather than a,like a picture.So we had to change the,it had to get bigger.It had to get taller.It had to get wider.And and we have that now in our kitchen and we have plants that hang in it.Yeah.So we can look and go.There was the alpha version.Nothing goes to waste here.So then we got to getting bigger and then,We had to do some rigorous testing,we had to make sure that could handle the torque and,how would we connect it to the wall so that it would have a floating feature.And and be able to take the pouncing of a cat jumping up and down and on it.And also Brian's parents came up with,which is being illustrated perfectly right now by your cat,is she moves from,I'll get somebody else but their idea also,Beyond just putting them in a frame.Like what about switching of this art concept?So we were like,I think that's one of,that's smart idea,but then it brought us back to dressing your cats.And so holiday backdrops are the best way ah,for that to happen.So we have a holiday section on our site.But let me get back to that.So we installed the first one.That was the size you see now,which is23inches wide by18inches high by nine inches deep.So it's nice and big,good wide space.And one of the things that we had to really think about too was the fir the frames.So we originally,Christina and I were like,oh,it'd be great if we got reclaimed.Wood from a thrift store.And my dad is yeah,good luck with scaling that.Like it's gonna fall apart.There's no integrity.You can get a hundred year old piece of wood from a church or a barn and people will be mad when it's splinters.And yeah,so smart.We ended up going with actual real framing materials.Professional framers use.Okay.And that's what they look outstanding.So yeah,they look just like any other frame you would have.That right is meant to be on the wall.They are meant that this is not a cheap plastic or anything like that.It's the real deal.And that's why we're really proud of the product that we've Come up with,because it just looks so good on the wall,even when a cat's not in there at the moment.Yeah,so it I think that's important because like you said,cat trees or even just you guys have.Some that are just playing shelves that they're sitting on when they're not there.It's like,why do you just have a shelf on your wall?But with the art,then it's still nice to look at whether there's a cat in there or not.And so it's a great way to think about it.So when we installed the first one,we didn't know,cuz we didn't know how our cats would react to it.So we just put up and it was.They just,you don't have to train'em.They just instinctively don't gunk.And then,but what they,what was a happy surprise for us was that they loved sitting in there for long periods of time.Because they feel like they're enclosed in a box.Box.In a box,yeah.Cause there's a ceiling and there's a floor and then the frame gives it the sense of security.So that's been the cool happy accident because the feedback we're getting from our users or what we call them,not user clients,Our customers,our customer customers.We have our communities,our community.Yes.Our fam,I call'em the fam.The response is the same.It's all off the hook because their cats are constantly,they take do it right.Wanting to be in there and.What's super special is that we have this really cool carpeting on the lower shelf there in there,and it's got this like groove texture and the cats just love digging at it.Oh,I'm sure.And guess what?And it keeps'em warm.Yeah.And And the carpeting is replaceable.So that's what's cool.Everything,we've built it out.So like the pet owner doesn't get frustrated cuz they have something and it looks ratty on their wall.The frames are interchangeable and the artwork is interchangeable.Show a little.So once you install it,one of them,you could change the frame out at any point in time.You could change the artwork out at any time.There goes c.And yeah,I was watching some of your videos on YouTube and it's really cool because even like you said,when you're talking about holidays,seasonal art,you find really cute things,but it's I'm only gonna have that up for a month or two months,or whatever it may be.So that's another great aspect because then you don't get bored with it.You don't get bored.You can take great pictures of your cat with different backdrops.And so we call them artwork panels and then this is a very popular I dunno if we can really say it.Happy birthday to meow The favorite,oh my gosh.Of every cat.So you can put their little food in there or their treats and then take a picture that's.I love it because it is so true.It goes back to why you guys thought about doing it.It is so true.Like I only have cats currently and they're just not about posing an acute costume or even on your lap,or it's just not having a dog that's okay,I'll sit here for five minutes with a scarf on.And so it is a great way to get.In as in a place where it has some kind of setting that you can get their picture and you don't even need to,you,you don't have to coax them in there and Right.Oh,I hope they just will sit and look at you and they'll be like,what happened?What happened to you?Why are you looking at me?But I think that's where we realized that cats are smarter than dogs,right?Yes.They don't just wanna have a costume on them.They're like,nah,yeah,my mine don't go for that.Yeah,my first one did,but that was cuz he was a little bit of a show.He liked to show off his food tale and stuff.But yeah,usually not.And I do also agree with you in terms of cats,they love that feeling of being inside and being hidden.It's a safety for them.And so giving them that I,I'm sure is why they like it so much.And then like where Winnie is right now,that's her favorite frame.We have our fireplace over here,so she'll sit in that frame and just stare at the fireplace all winter long.And that's fun.We have one in our kitchen,the cat's,like the morning light.We put one in our bedroom where we shot a video that Brian's gonna upload a nice time lapse of how quick and easy it is.And we are going to put one in our home office pretty soon.I think that's the next one.Yeah,because that's the afternoon light.So the cat follow the light.Yeah,the light.Yes.No,absolutely.And I,and it's also.Seasonal.I know,my cats like to lay at certain places certain times of year.As our listeners may not,we both live in parts of California that are very hot.In the suburb.We have the AC cranked right now,still in October.I know,it's what?I don't even know.88today or something like that.Yeah,it's rid,ridiculous.It's ridiculous.But it affects the cats in terms of where they wanna lay.Like I have a window in my bedroom that they love to lay in,but only to a certain point of the day where it's okay,now it's just too hot to be there.So that's great that you can put these in different places.Parts of the day that they can enjoy.Yeah,this is,yeah.So the other rooms have one.But this is our super wall where we have two and a series of step shelves for them to climb in and out of.Yeah,that's great.Yeah.So a cat superhigh,you guys have a superhighway.And we have left this wall blank on purpose so that when people see this,they can imagine how they would style it in their own place.But we have a user in Salem,Massachusetts,and she has put plants that she knows are fine for her.Cats all around it.And Madonna pictures and like faith candles and stuff.So she's created a whole gallery wall.Stunning.No,that's,I love that because one of the things I've been thinking about too is shifting the way my opposite so I can have the wall behind me and all my different animal art.So yeah,you could totally add that into it,and it just goes with it.But then the,it can become interactive for the cats.Oh,yeah.And I can see how she just doesn't even care that you're changing them out.She just,no,she'll sit in there as she's swapping out the art,because the cat,again,feels so secure.In there.That you know why leave.Do you,so do you ever have the cats fight over a particular spot?So like too off,they don't fight.Last night in the kitchen,two of our cats were laying inside the frame together.And they're big cats.Wow.And just to show you,look,I wish I had,Christina did take a picture.We'll have to send it to you.Okay.Oh,but it's pretty amazing.They all wanna be in it.That's why we say if you have more than.On our website we have suggested layouts of if you're gonna put in our shelves or,and if they have their own shelves,like the way you may wanna have it set up,if you have more than one cat.So that way there's an entry and exit point on both sides.So that way if one wants to get in,the other one can leave.Otherwise you end up with a traffic jam.And that's something we learned very early on cuz the cats all wanted to get in it and one's waiting let or no,that's,yeah,you want that flow through so they can go in and out whichever way they want to.No,that's great.I just love watching your cats go in and out of them.Honestly.That is Poppy.She is three,and she's from Palmdale Animal Care Center.She's the largest cat in the house.Don't tell anybody.Yeah.So she was in the frame with Mojave.And they're both big.And they're both big and they were just all like loving each other in the frame.Then you can see that there's plenty of space for them.Even her and it's okay.Us big girls want our art space too.I had a Cosmo and he was quite thick.We called him Chunky Monkey.Oh.So I told,but there's nothing.And it's,I just have to say that cats are like people.We come in all different shapes and sizes.Yes.And so we try to post all over our social media.Our cats and everybody else's cats.So we have a Manco,we have a Bengal we have these beautiful Persian cats,Egyptian cats,some Sinese cats.We have our little forever kitten,Holly,who's maybe seven pounds.And that's,I guess how all she's ever gonna be.We try to show a variety.And also just coloring so people can figure.Which colors they like,what fits your aesthetic,but also maybe what makes your cat pop.And that's why I put out this purple gradient one.Our black and white cat jolly looks amazing on that one.So we have,if you just if you want color if you want nature,if you want signs,we have a solid green backdrop artwork panel that you could get so you can chrome a key,anything you want behind your cat.Oh my God,that's amazing.I might be having to get that one.I'm always trying to figure out new ways of doing videos with my cats,but it's like they're always in the same spot,like on the bed or laying in a cat bed and it's like boring.So I love that.Yeah.So if you do the green,you're go,you're golden.You had mentioned the YouTube videos,so some people are,How does this work?Like how do I,yeah.Cuz I first found you guys on Instagram and so in still pictures you,you see it,but it doesn't make all the sense to you.So I'm,that's great that you guys have the video of showing how to use it,showing the cats going in and out of'em.It really helps people understand it.And I also appreciate the architecture aspect of it because my husband is a carpenter,so I totally understood everything when you guys were talking about the different kinds of wood.He'll tell me,never buy anything from this company again cuz it's not good quality.Quality matters,especially when you're dealing with something like this for cats.We bought one that was supposed to attach to the window.Yeah.It didn't,yeah.I couldn't even put my hand on it,let alone our cat jump on it.So we want people who install this in their homes or their apartments,condos to feel.Comfortable and safe knowing that when they follow the instructions that there's not gonna be a problem.We want cats to be happy and healthy,and enjoy this.We don't want I did,when we first put up the sliding art,like one time Winnie was like,what is that?And she didn't come by for a day or two,and now she's doesn't remember it,so at first I was like,oh no,maybe that's a problem.But there is a special lip in the back of the frame.So when you.The artwork in it stays.If you don't put it in okay and push it in,then it'll fall.So I think that's the big difference between a product like ours and the other products that are for pets is this one is purposely built.For quality and lasting forever,essentially.It shouldn't,unless you're like taking a sledgehammer to it,right?But the point of this product is that it's an investment that will carry through for future cats to come.And you can always take it down and put it onto a different wall if you move or wherever,right?So it's something meant to go with you,and it's not meant to just be like,oh,we're done with it.Throw it away now it.This is not a throwaway product.This is,yeah.Which is so important for cats because they do like to tear things up,whether it's with chewing or scratching or whatever it is.And like you said,with cat trees,a lot of times their material did absorb the smell.And all of that.And it only there is a length of time.You just have to get rid of them.Yeah.So I like that this is material that's easily cleaned or replaceable and interchangeable.And we've had this carpet on these shelves for over three years and we have not replaced them yet.And we have had.Seven cats that have been on all of these.So what I do is I just use my little zoom groom.It's right there once a month just to get up all the extra fur and if you give them treats or somebody puts dinner on there once in a while,cause we have to separate them sometimes when they're having their meals.So you just get up all that and vacuum it and it looks great.But if you know you're somebody that doesn't like one little thing of string,then you can shave it off,trim it,or you can replace it.But we,they really go at it and again,like just putting this together was such a project.You think it's like easy,you're like,oh yeah,frame the shot.Yeah,I got it.It's no,we have to shoot,install videos.So gimme hand me one of those images.Any particular one?Something colorful or vibrant or,sorry,here we go.It's okay.Yeah.This is.Oh yeah.So this is a sunset backdrop.I'm an artist back in Massachusetts.Yeah,this is a pho a photo.It's just amazing.So it's beautiful getting these images on.Oh this,it's So for those who are just listening,hopefully you'll watch this episode.But the artwork.Backdrops.The artwork panels are a semi rigid.Thermo plastic,which mean,and it's fine for cats.They can try to scratch at it.They could throw up a hairball.I always say,what?Wipe it down with a wet cloth and the colors will not run.It is.This is really built for even outdoor kind of right to,to handle the weather elements,right?So we really wanted these pieces to look vibrant.And the printing that we have done on these,the colors just pop.I don't know if this can translate,but No.Yeah,it looks great.The colors really come through and that's where like we have.People who are coming to us who are photographers,graphic artists who are like,Hey,I wanna get my stuff as back panels for frame your feeling lines.Oh,that's great.And so we have a creative community.It's in our,about area,on our website.And you can contribute and you can have your artwork featured on our website and people.Have that for their cats and take pictures of your work with their cats.That's so cool.I love that because then it's a way for artists to share their work too.Sure.And it's been fun for us too because as a family,we have a six year old and we will go places and we'll shoot pictures and Jackson's I wanna take a picture of this for frame your feeling.And so we actually drove up to near where you live in2020to the al.Blossoms.Oh yeah.And we took a lot of pictures of that.Yes,we've taken pictures at Mountain High,some wild west places,some aquatic stuff from here in California.So it's fun for us as a family get outta the office and let the cats do their thing and go find some cool things to shoot.Yep.No,that's great.I was just,Thank you when you showed the sunset.I don't know if you guys have ever been on the Central Coast,Morro Bay.I have great photos from there of the Moro Rock and thinking,I love having those up and think I could just put it in there with the cat and they could be.You could,yeah,a hundred percent.So that's,I love that.So it can be something that you really love to look at,whether the cat's sitting there or.I really like that idea.Yeah.We do have so if you,if let's say you have a great photo and you don't want to be a contributing artist,right?Yes.You don't want anybody else to have access,right?I don't want anyone else to have my image.No.Then we do have customized our work panels where you just order that you can upload your photo and it will be printed on our huge.18by23inch.Image.And then you could have that as a backdrop and only you will have that one.Yeah.Which is cool.We have businesses that have done their logo for the backdrop.Oh,that's cool.Yeah,some vegetarian,some cat rescues.Cuz especially like for a rescue,it's great cuz boom,the cat's in there and now you can take a nice picture and yeah.Things marketable because that's a sad thing and that's the reality,especially where we are talking from in California.Unfortunately,all these animal care centers,the pound,are full of animals that don't always make it out.And a big problem is you go online and you see these pictures of these cats that are frightened and they look like they're in just a disgusting,dirty place.Now imagine if the pictures were elevated and you're like,That's a beautiful cat,right?Not a cat,hiding and stuff.We,our goal really,is we wanna have one frame in every room of every home of anybody that owns a cat.But we would also really love to reach out to the rescues and have the rescues want to have a feline frame up and have their logo behind it.The cats are more exciting to look at and people,yeah.Don't overlook them.No,I think that is so important.In general,animals and shelters are difficult to be seen because their life is in a cage now.And I know a shelter I work with,they had a photographer start volunteering.They're taking these amazing pictures of the dog.Now I'm like what about the cats?Cats don't always wanna have their picture taken.And I volunteered this rescue and when I was there last week,cleaning the cages,you move the cat from one to the next as you clean and sanitize.You know when you first see'em in the cage,they seem so sad and to themselves,but then when you pick them up and they're like happy and they wanna play that,it is difficult to show that to people who are interested in adopting that.Yeah.What they look like in that atmosphere is,The cat,they're gonna be for you most likely.Yep.Yeah,no,I really love that idea.And thank you for your volunteer work too.Oh,thank you.Because that's very important.Yes.And Dogs and cats,either one.People don't realize when they're in a shelter,they don't get that one-on-one interaction.The staff only have so much time in the day and they have to clean and take care of them.They don't get to go on a walk as a dog,or they don't get to be taken out and played with as a kitten.And so anything like that you can do is so important.Even though then I just wanna bring them all home.I know.It's can we,that's the hard part.I know.Speak,speaking of animal shelters and rescues,you guys mentioned to me an organization,I don't know if you work with them or have known,called Piper,helping Pause.Yes.We don't personally know them other than we've interacted with them on next door.Okay.Through they are,we have two rescues that I know of in our area,and unfortunately in.The Antelope Valley.A lot of animals are neglected.They are dropped in the desert.They are used for dog fighting and other things.And this woman she is a vet tech and she has right now30,32kittens that she oh,is taking to get transported cuz we do have some programs through Karma Rescue or the Karma Project where you.Essentially have the neutering done for free,the spay or neuter for free.But she still has to drive an hour and a half.And oddly enough,I'm pretty sure she's taking all her cats to where we took our little cat,scrappy that resides outside.I wanted to give them a little shout out because I know when you're starting,she's not really starting small because she has,they're over32kittens right now and she has a couple dogs.And we hope eventually we bought the domain name years ago,wounded whiskers.com,and we hope down the road to be able to have enough money through frame your fee line to offer spay neuter programs.And then what's really something for us is people.Mostly elderly people,but when people pass on or they have dementia and they can no longer take care of their pets,what happens to that pet?So we wanna really start to inform people like you have to be a responsible pet parent,and if something happens to you,you need to have some money
